title: The twins who tricked the Maya gods of death - Ilan Stavans

multiple-choice.question: What were Jun and Wuqub doing when they disturbed the lords of the underworld?

options.label: A
options.text: They were playing a quiet game of chess.

options.label: B
options.text: They were having a loud argument.

options.label: C
options.text: They were running back and forth playing ball.

options.label: D
options.text: They were practicing a new dance.

multiple-choice.question: What happened to Jun's head after he was killed by the lords of the underworld?

options.label: A
options.text: It was buried in a grave.

options.label: B
options.text: It was hung from a tree as a trophy.

options.label: C
options.text: It was thrown into a river.

options.label: D
options.text: It was given to his brother as a gift.

multiple-choice.question: How did Jun's skull impregnate the lord's daughter?

options.label: A
options.text: She kissed it and became pregnant.

options.label: B
options.text: It spat on her hand and impregnated her.

options.label: C
options.text: She touched it and became pregnant.

options.label: D
options.text: She looked at it and became pregnant.

multiple-choice.question: What challenge did the messengers from the underworld issue to Junajpu and Ixb'alanke?

options.label: A
options.text: A challenge to a game of chess.

options.label: B
options.text: A challenge to a game of ball.

options.label: C
options.text: A challenge to a dance competition.

options.label: D
options.text: A challenge to a singing contest.

multiple-choice.question: How did the twins survive the night in the House of Darkness?

options.label: A
options.text: They used a flashlight to light their way.

options.label: B
options.text: They adorned the torch with red macaw feathers and fireflies.

options.label: C
options.text: They used a map to navigate the darkness.

options.label: D
options.text: They hid under a bed.

multiple-choice.question: What was hidden inside the ball used by the lords of the underworld?

options.label: A
options.text: A small toy.

options.label: B
options.text: A treat.

options.label: C
options.text: A weapon.

options.label: D
options.text: A note.

multiple-choice.question: How did Ixb'alanke trick the lords into thinking Junajpu's head was still hanging over the court?

options.label: A
options.text: He used magic to make it disappear.

options.label: B
options.text: He swapped it with a chilacayote squash carved into the likeness of a head.

options.label: C
options.text: He hid it behind a mask.

options.label: D
options.text: He threw it into the river.

multiple-choice.question: How did the twins ultimately defeat the lords of the underworld?

options.label: A
options.text: They won the game of ball and then killed the lords.

options.label: B
options.text: They performed a miracle and then killed the lords.

options.label: C
options.text: They disguised themselves as children and then killed the lords.

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above.

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of the twins' curse on the lords of the underworld?

options.label: A
options.text: The lords gained more power over the surface world.

options.label: B
options.text: The lords were forced to play the game of ball forever.

options.label: C
options.text: The lords had no sacrifices and no power over the surface world.

options.label: D
options.text: The lords were turned into animals.

multiple-choice.question: What was the significance of the twins' victory over the lords of the underworld?

options.label: A
options.text: It marked the beginning of a new era of terror for humans.

options.label: B
options.text: It marked the end of the lords' power over the surface world.

options.label: C
options.text: It marked the beginning of a new game of ball.

options.label: D
options.text: It marked the end of the twins' journey.

title: The sleep disorder you might not know you have - Alayna Vaughan

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary cause of snoring?

options.label: A
options.text: Congestion in the nasal passages

options.label: B
options.text: The vibration of relaxed tissues in the respiratory tract

options.label: C
options.text: The sudden stoppage of breathing during sleep

options.label: D
options.text: The narrowing of the airway due to anatomical features

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the sleep disorder characterized by loud, chronic snoring and pauses in breathing during sleep?

options.label: A
options.text: Central sleep apnea

options.label: B
options.text: Obstructive sleep apnea

options.label: C
options.text: Sleep deprivation disorder

options.label: D
options.text: Insomnia

multiple-choice.question: What percentage of people who suffer from obstructive sleep apnea are estimated to be unaware they have it?
What is the main difference between obstructive sleep apnea and central sleep apnea?

options.label: A
options.text: Obstructive sleep apnea is caused by blockages in the airway, while central sleep apnea is caused by the brain's failure to regulate breathing.

options.label: B
options.text: Obstructive sleep apnea is more common than central sleep apnea.

options.label: C
options.text: Central sleep apnea is characterized by louder snoring than obstructive sleep apnea.

options.label: D
options.text: Obstructive sleep apnea is more severe than central sleep apnea.

multiple-choice.question: What is a common consequence of obstructive sleep apnea?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased oxygen intake

options.label: B
options.text: Decreased blood pressure

options.label: C
options.text: Improved concentration

options.label: D
options.text: Increased risk of cardiovascular problems

multiple-choice.question: What is a behavioral shift that may help alleviate obstructive sleep apnea?

options.label: A
options.text: Drinking alcohol before bedtime

options.label: B
options.text: Sleeping on your back

options.label: C
options.text: Elevating your head during sleep

options.label: D
options.text: Gaining weight

multiple-choice.question: What is a common treatment for obstructive sleep apnea?

options.label: A
options.text: Surgery

options.label: B
options.text: Oral appliances

options.label: C
options.text: CPAP machines

options.label: D
options.text: Weight gain

multiple-choice.question: What is a risk factor for developing obstructive sleep apnea?

options.label: A
options.text: Having a smaller tongue

options.label: B
options.text: Having a larger jaw

options.label: C
options.text: Being younger

options.label: D
options.text: Gaining weight

multiple-choice.question: What is a potential consequence of untreated obstructive sleep apnea?

options.label: A
options.text: Improved sleep quality

options.label: B
options.text: Increased energy levels

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased risk of cardiovascular problems

options.label: D
options.text: Chronic fatigue

multiple-choice.question: Why do doctors usually aim to remedy sleep apnea with non-invasive treatments first?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they are more expensive

options.label: B
options.text: Because they are less effective

options.label: C
options.text: Because they are less invasive and may be sufficient to treat the condition

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are more complicated

title: 3 secrets of resilient people - Lucy Hone

multiple-choice.question: What was the speaker's main quest in life?

options.label: A
options.text: To become a psychologist

options.label: B
options.text: To work out how to take the best of scientific findings out of academia and bring them to people in their everyday lives

options.label: C
options.text: To study resilience research

options.label: D
options.text: To become a researcher

multiple-choice.question: What event occurred in 2014 that changed the speaker's life?

options.label: A
options.text: The Christchurch earthquakes

options.label: B
options.text: A car accident that killed her 12-year-old daughter and two others

options.label: C
options.text: The speaker's divorce

options.label: D
options.text: The speaker's mother passed away

multiple-choice.question: What did the speaker find unhelpful about the advice she received after her daughter's death?

options.label: A
options.text: It was too focused on the positive

options.label: B
options.text: It was too focused on the negative and made her feel like a victim

options.label: C
options.text: It was too general

options.label: D
options.text: It was too specific

multiple-choice.question: What is the first strategy for resilience mentioned by the speaker?

options.label: A
options.text: Choosing where to focus your attention

options.label: B
options.text: Asking yourself if what you're doing is helping or harming you

options.label: C
options.text: Recognizing that suffering is a part of life

options.label: D
options.text: Practicing gratitude

multiple-choice.question: What is the concept of "benefit finding" in psychology?

options.label: A
options.text: Focusing on the negative aspects of a situation

options.label: B
options.text: Trying to find things to be grateful for in a difficult situation

options.label: C
options.text: Ignoring the negative aspects of a situation

options.label: D
options.text: Dwelling on the past

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of Martin Seligman's 2005 experiment on gratitude?

options.label: A
options.text: Participants showed lower levels of gratitude and happiness

options.label: B
options.text: Participants showed higher levels of gratitude, happiness, and depression

options.label: C
options.text: Participants showed higher levels of gratitude, happiness, and lower levels of depression

options.label: D
options.text: Participants showed no change in gratitude or happiness

multiple-choice.question: What is the third strategy for resilience mentioned by the speaker?

options.label: A
options.text: Choosing where to focus your attention

options.label: B
options.text: Asking yourself if what you're doing is helping or harming you

options.label: C
options.text: Recognizing that suffering is a part of life

options.label: D
options.text: Practicing mindfulness

multiple-choice.question: How does the speaker suggest applying the third strategy for resilience?

options.label: A
options.text: By asking yourself the question only once a day

options.label: B
options.text: By asking yourself the question in every situation

options.label: C
options.text: By asking yourself the question only in difficult situations

options.label: D
options.text: By not asking yourself the question at all

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's message about resilience?

options.label: A
options.text: It's a fixed trait that some people have and some people don't

options.label: B
options.text: It's something that can be learned and developed

options.label: C
options.text: It's only necessary in extreme situations

options.label: D
options.text: It's not important for everyday life

multiple-choice.question: What does the speaker say is possible to do even in the midst of great pain and grief?

options.label: A
options.text: To avoid feeling any pain or grief

options.label: B
options.text: To live and grieve at the same time

options.label: C
options.text: To forget the past

options.label: D
options.text: To move on quickly

options.text: Mozart

options.label: B
options.text: Haydn

options.label: C
options.text: Ludwig van Beethoven

options.label: D

options.text: He only composed music for religious functions

options.label: B
options.text: He was one of the first freelance composers

options.label: C

options.text: Classical

options.label: B
options.text: Romanticism

options.label: C
options.text: Baroque

options.label: D

options.label: B
options.text: Symphony motif

options.label: C
options.text: Rhythmic pattern

options.label: D
options.text: Musical hook

options.label: A
options.text: It creates forward movement

options.label: B
options.text: It signals doom

options.label: C
options.text: It creates a sense of resolution

options.label: D

options.label: A
options.text: He used a smaller orchestra

options.label: B
options.text: He used a wider range of instruments, including trombones, piccolo, and contrabassoon

multiple-choice.question: What is the emotional arc of the Fifth Symphony in terms of harmony?

options.text: From C major to C minor

options.text: From C minor to C major

options.label: C
options.text: From somber to somber

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: What personal challenge was Beethoven facing while composing his Fifth Symphony?

options.label: A
options.text: He was struggling with financial difficulties

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: He was experiencing personal relationship issues

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: How has the Fifth Symphony's central motif been used outside of concert halls?

options.label: A
options.text: As a symbol for suspense, revelation, and triumph

options.label: B
options.text: As a symbol for defeat and loss

options.label: C
options.text: As a symbol for love and relationships

options.label: D
options.text: As a symbol for nature and beauty

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: It sounds out the letter D

title: The simplest math problem no one can solve

multiple-choice.question: What is the Collatz Conjecture?

options.label: A
options.text: A mathematical problem that deals with the distribution of prime numbers.

options.label: B
options.text: A conjecture that states every positive integer will eventually end up in the 4, 2, 1 loop when applying the 3x+1 rules.

options.label: C
options.text: A theorem that proves the existence of infinite loops in the 3x+1 sequence.

options.label: D
options.text: A problem that deals with the properties of perfect squares.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the mathematician who said, "Mathematics is not yet ripe enough for such questions"?

options.label: A
options.text: Paul Erdos

options.label: B
options.text: Luther Collatz

options.label: C
options.text: Jeffrey Lagarias

options.label: D
options.text: Terry Tao

multiple-choice.question: What is the term used to describe the numbers obtained by applying the 3x+1 rules?

options.label: A
options.text: Hailstone numbers

options.label: B
options.text: Collatz numbers

options.label: C
options.text: Fibonacci numbers

options.label: D
options.text: Benford numbers

multiple-choice.question: What is the distribution of leading digits in the 3x+1 sequence known as?

options.label: A
options.text: Benford's Law

options.label: B
options.text: Collatz's Law

options.label: C
options.text: Erdos's Law

options.label: D
options.text: Lagarias's Law

multiple-choice.question: What is the term used to describe the paths of numbers in the 3x+1 sequence?

options.label: A
options.text: Directed graph

options.label: B
options.text: Undirected graph

options.label: C
options.text: Tree structure

options.label: D
options.text: Coral representation

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of Terry Tao's proof regarding the Collatz Conjecture?

options.label: A
options.text: He proved that all numbers will eventually end up in the 4, 2, 1 loop.

options.label: B
options.text: He proved that almost all numbers will have a number in their sequence that is arbitrarily small.

options.label: C
options.text: He disproved the Collatz Conjecture.

options.label: D
options.text: He proved that the Collatz Conjecture is undecidable.

multiple-choice.question: Why is it difficult to prove the Collatz Conjecture?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it is a simple problem.

options.label: B
options.text: Because it is a complex problem.

options.label: C
options.text: Because it is undecidable.

options.label: D
options.text: Because we have not found a counterexample yet.

multiple-choice.question: What is the term used to describe the problem of determining whether a given program will run forever or stop?

options.label: A
options.text: Halting problem

options.label: B
options.text: Collatz problem

options.label: C
options.text: Erdos problem

options.label: D
options.text: Lagarias problem

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the mathematical machine created by John Conway that is Turing-complete?

options.label: A
options.text: FRACTRAN

options.label: B
options.text: COLLATZ

options.label: C
options.text: ERDOS

options.label: D
options.text: LAGARIAS

multiple-choice.question: What is the implication of the Collatz Conjecture being undecidable?

options.label: A
options.text: We will never be able to prove or disprove it.

options.label: B
options.text: We will eventually be able to prove or disprove it.

options.label: C
options.text: It is a simple problem.

options.label: D
options.text: It is a complex problem.

title: What few people know about the program that "saved" America - Meg Jacobs

multiple-choice.question: What was the unemployment rate in the United States in 1932?

options.text: 1 in 5 Americans

options.label: B
options.text: 1 in 4 Americans

options.label: C
options.text: 1 in 3 Americans

options.label: D
options.text: 1 in 2 Americans

options.label: B
options.text: Herbert Hoover

options.text: Theodore Roosevelt

options.text: Calvin Coolidge

options.label: B
options.text: Stabilizing the banks

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: B
options.text: To support farmers

options.label: C
options.text: To catalog each state's need for relief and provide funds

options.label: D

options.label: B
options.text: To support farmers

options.label: C
options.text: To provide relief to citizens

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: What was the impact of the New Deal on Black communities in the South?

options.label: A
options.text: They received a large share of jobs and vocational training

options.label: B
options.text: They received an influx of public housing

options.label: C
options.text: They were excluded from many New Deal programs

options.text: Due to a lack of funding

options.label: C

options.label: A

options.text: They were excluded from some labor laws

options.label: C
options.text: They were unaffected by labor laws

multiple-choice.question: What was the long-term impact of the New Deal on the Democratic Party?

options.label: A
options.text: It led to a decline in the party's popularity

options.label: B
options.text: It led to a shift towards more conservative policies

options.label: C
options.text: It led to a challenge to the party's racist leadership

options.label: D
options.text: It had no impact on the party

multiple-choice.question: What event ultimately led to the full recovery of the US economy?

options.label: A
options.text: The implementation of the New Deal

options.label: B
options.text: The mobilization for World War II

options.label: C
options.text: The establishment of a national minimum wage

options.label: D
options.text: The creation of the Social Security Act

title: The epic of Gilgamesh, the king who tried to conquer death - Soraya Field Fiorio

options.label: B
options.text: Nineveh

options.text: Babylon

options.label: D
options.text: Ashur
